title: DiZoglio rallies her troops for audit of Legislature at State House rally
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Politics The Legislature’s noncompliance with the audit passed last year is “slapping voters in the face," said the state auditor.
"Audit the Legislature" signs line the steps of the Massachusetts State House during a rally on Wednesday.
Madison Lucchesi/Boston.

title: Why Mike Vrabel reached out to fired coach who replaced him in Tennessee
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots “We’re not trying to win one for the Gipper here.
" Mike Vrabel is set to face his former team in the Titans on Sunday.
Photo by Matthew J Lee/Globe staff The Titans’ decision to fire Mike Vrabel as head coach in January 2024 hasn’t panned out all that well.

title: North Shore bridge closed indefinitely after inspection turns up need for urgent repairs
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Local News The closure of the bridge linking Saugus and Lynn will bring "extended" detours, MassDOT said.
File - A temporary bridge linking Saugus and Lynn while a new bridge is being constructed is closed indefinitely after an inspection indicated repairs are needed.

David L Ryan/The Boston Globe The Route 107 bridge over the Saugus River in Lynn and Saugus closed indefinitely on Wednesday after an inspection indicated it needs urgent repairs, state transportation officials announced.

title: Derrick Henry to the Patriots? Adam Schefter doesn’t see trade happening
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots "They’re getting ready to make what they believe is a second-half run.
" Derrick Henry has continued to dominate in the trenches with Baltimore.

AP Photo/Nick Wass By Conor Ryan October 15, 2025 | 7:44 PM 2 minutes to read The Patriots could use some reinforcements in the run game this fall, given that New England ranks 26th in the league in rushing yards per game.

title: Jason Varitek addresses coaching future with Red Sox on WEEI
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox "There's a lot of opportunities out there as far as managing roles.
We'll see if any of that transpires.
" Jason Varitek's contract with the Red Sox is set to expire this offseason.

title: Boston’s iconic CITGO sign is moving — but staying in Kenmore Square
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Local News As part of a redevelopment project, the CITGO sign is set to be moved 30 feet higher and 120 feet east of where it sits now in Kenmore Square.
The CITGO sign is illuminated as the sun goes down on February 27, 2017.

Keith Bedford/The Boston Globe For more than 60 years, the iconic CITGO sign has beamed above Kenmore Square, greeting Boston Marathon runners and looming over Fenway Park like a low-hanging, neon (now LED) moon.

title: Bruins Mailbag: Is David Pastrnak setting himself up as Boston’s next captain?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins The Bruins have jumped out to a 3-1-0 start so far this season behind a strong showing from Jeremy Swayman and several other contributors.
David Pastrnak has impressed out of the gate for the Bruins.

AP Photo/Nick Wass By Conor Ryan October 15, 2025 | 5:14 PM 13 minutes to read With the 2025-26 Bruins season now underway, we reached out to Bruins fans on social media for all questions related to the local hockey team.
